sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A true and perfect account of a strange and dreadful apparition which lately infested and sunk a ship bound for New-Castle, called the Hope-well of London and of the strange deliverance of John Pye, master, and nine men more, who were all examined and sworn to the truth of the following relation before Justice Wood of London. Pye, John, Master. Jemson, Nathaniel.
11 p.
Printed for Robert Clavel, London : 1672.
Also attributed to Nathaniel Jemson. Cf. Wing. "With allowance, Roger L'Estrange, March 30, 1672" Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
=======
A true and perfect account of a strange and dreadful apparition which lately infested and sunk a ship bound for New-Castle, called the Hope-well of London and of the strange deliverance of John Pye, master, and nine men more, who were all examined and sworn to the truth of the following relation before Justice Wood of London. Pye, John, Master. Jemson, Nathaniel.
11 p.
Printed for Robert Clavel, London : 1672.
Also attributed to Nathaniel Jemson. Cf. Wing. "With allowance, Roger L'Estrange, March 30, 1672" Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
Robert Clavel
